posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Its certainly an interesting idea to make a charisma based spellsword with EMA and EW! It's ambitious too!

I'm not super familiar with these classes but, suggestions to try to help:

Would like more HP. I read this comment from Kail some time ago and try to get as close as I can (sometimes I miss the target by about 50hp, but the main thing is being able to tank enough damage to stand in melee)
Kail Pendragon wrote (toughness-called-shot-why-all-the-love- ... ml#p1272[b]): 
I[/b]n general Toughness is not a bad feat (eventually equivalent to 2 epic feats) to have although it's not high on my priorities. It's a good way to bring HPs up to a desired mark (at lvl 40 for me it's 400 HPs for those involved regularly in melee without being absolute melee specialists, 300 for casters, 500 for dedicated meleers).
Both Bard and Sorcerer have terrible HP rolls. 

Maybe a starting Str of 16, Cons 14 and Int 14 could put you in the right direction achieve what you need. +40 hp and +43 skill points is worth dropping 1 Str for I think. You could even drop Int to 10 and put Cons to 16, it might be worth imputing the numbers to see what each looks like before you make a decision

I think squeezing a third class in would be good. 

Would be great to have Blackguard for the bonus to saves /martial weapon foci / heavy armor proficiency and possibly Divine Might in the build but you would need to take power attack and cleave is the downside and the build is somewhat feat starved already. If you take BG, a Bard 13 / BG 3 / Sorc 24 split might be good

Fighter would also be tempting for +2 bonus feats as well plus heavy armor / martial weapon proficiency, with two levels. Can be taken epic for +2 great strengths or pre epic for +1 AB and extra combat feats/allowing you to have martial weapon foci. You'd get a 20% exp penalty but in a PW it won't matter as much. Bard 14 / F 2 / Sorc 24 split.

Mick also has just taught me about a trick with the ranger class. If you take a single level epic, you can use the ranger bonus feat for epic weapon focus or epic prowess. Bard 13 / R1 / Sorc 26 would be what I'd do if you did that. Bard 13 I think has level 5 bard spells so I don't think you'd lose a lot?

Would like more AB if possible (you've tried pretty hard I can see!), this is going to be challenging. UMD is helpful on WoG to access Divine Power and PnP Tensor's

Alternatively your classes have tools to lower AC. Taunt to help with hitting enemies. Curse song might be good? I dont know enough to comment but the bonus to hitting things with zero chance of failure would be helpful. Would swap lingering song for this. 

In WoG I have been told not to worry about Arcane spell failure / Auto Still Spell, one can easily socket an item with all those -% arcanist gems (more experienced players pls correct me if I'm wrong)

Anyway its an interesting idea, got a lot of potential I think, with the proviso I'm not a bard/sorc expert at all

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Since you don't take any feats that require 13 INT or better, you should go with STr16, Cha16, Con14, Int12, instead. The final attributes would be the same but you just gained 40 hps. Lasting Inspiration requires 20 Bard levels, so it isn't possible with this class-split & he already has lingering song which extends his song duration to 15 rounds each. Expertise, while a nice feat to have, it's not for this build, we have many more important feats to take, including of course curse song. And btw, your AB is fine for a spell-sword, Tenser's Transformation will make this 43AB instead of 36AB & giving you four attack/round as well. As for the armor, there is both a medium one (or two) & a certain buckler that don't have any chance of spell-failure. It's gonna be 3AC worse than full plate & tower shield combo in total, but that's a small price to pay for discounting four whole feats (the three of them epic) from your build.

posts.content:
I think this looks nice.

With curse song and bard song active, your effective AB will be 36 +2(bs) +3(cs) = 41

Add extended PnP Tensors which is undispellable = +13AB + 2d4/Str * 0.5 [if not at cap] = +15 AB on average. it also will add up 26d6 hp combined with +16hp from bard song will help get that HP up to about 400 which is kind of the target for a melee character.

With an effective AB of 56 I would assume you will not have trouble hitting things, although the only way to be sure is to try out the build. Perhaps Taunt would be overkill here?

You could also add aid and bless from potions or a scabbard of blessing for a further +2 AB

To answer your question on gems, there are two types. 

You have encountered the green type which is the least common, and the old gem system. My experience is these have fixed drop points (ie not random). Only green gems can be socketed in green items. I have only encountered the morningstar that you have also encountered, but I have not fully explored undermountain / underdark yet.

The more common gem are the teal type which randomly drop. These get socketed into teal socketed items, which have a (x) which tells you how many sockets the item has. The maximum sockets is 6 and minimum sockets 1. ie: Socketed Greataxe (2) = 2 sockets

The ranger trick is Mick Dagger's nugget of knowledge I have spread around for general consumption :)

Maybe my interpretation is too simplistic, i.e. I don't take into account all the subtleties...but here is WoG version.

Tenser's Transformation - caster gains 2d4 STR and DEX, d6 hit points per caster level and +1 base attack bonus per 2 caster levels. You no longer polymorph into a doom knight so you get to keep spell slots gained via magic items that polymorphs unequip. AC bonus is now a +4 natural, not a +4 dodge. There are so many tricks you can do with a good spell-sword that are limited only by your imagination, really.

TS => Mord's => Full melee 1 round => TS => Full melee 2 rounds => TS => Full melee 2 rounds, etc. until he/she is dead. This works even better when your spell-sword has Dev Crit, which is basically double-cheddar in your sandwich.
That's quite a trick!

P.S.: I have tested, in the WoG offline module, the elemental princess in Critwall some minutes ago, if used well she is very destructive. :)
Now I understand why she has a great reputation!
Tomorrow I'll test it in a match with Arbas (although I think I can win by stacking empowered blade barriers with my cleric...)

It makes me tempted to input a level of cleric, the AB would drop by 1 but your calculation shows that, at highest levels (from lv 29/30), she should not be so worried about her AB....

I understand that with this combo is very difficult (if not impossible) to make an optimized build...feat starving, low CON, armor spell failure...but I'm sure it'll be fun (even if painful) to level it on WoG, this is an union of my favorite classes (so far)...

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
What I mean is this - it's a "one trick pony".

It's not sustainable without horrendous amounts of item luggage (and on WoG, with enough item luggage, you can basically do everything with just about any build).

So, you hack your way through the reddies,  maybe used some spells to buff, etc.

Get to the next level - even with planning  and careful tactics  used alot of resources to secure a key...

You now need to rest, regain oneself.

The next level requires even more, so rinse, repeat.

Then the Underdark - and things get...messy.

Finally, a chance to gain ones breath, and recuperate.

Perhaps one gets through to the Demonweb.

Now the drain begins.

Anyone who has done it knows what I mean.

You need PERFECT meta-knowledge here - and even that will not give you a breather!

By the time you face Lolth & Co, you'll be running on empty, because the build CANNOT sustain itself.

This is what I mean.

Can the build reach level 40 on WoG?

Yes, easily.

Is it something that can solo all the hard things on WoG?

Only under very good expertise and Server knowledge imo.

This is not straddling the fence imo.

It is just how things are.  NWN has no balance for a Spellsword aka the PrC or NWN2 with the Eldritch Knight and a feat that gives arcane castor levels back.

We all know this.

Spells from this Spellsword will "fizzle out" against Drow SR (not to mention most end boss SR, regardless of Mord's SR lowering).

The AB, and Arcane protections just don't cut it against the hordes in a clinch - and against Lolth, there is nowhere to run (not to mention navigating the demonweb).

Rary & Co present a similar conundrum - with Yugoloths and Golem constructs, some making the Shield strategy useless, along with the magical route.

This build has no Dev Crit to deal with the masses quickly and easily, making each battle a drain.

I ran into these problems early on on WoG, as I demonstrated that a Melee Mage could be viable - it is, but WoG presents a very difficult environment for such.

Kail did a lot of specialized builds of Spellswording, and sort of "invented" the Summons Wand spamming to drain dispels and breaches in order to prevent the drain on resources.

These days, you need an inventory of specific items, to get your Spellsword to the next "replenishment area".

So instead of saying "on the fence", I would describe it more like "been there, done that".

I concentrate on other builds to solo WoG, that are less time and tactically intensive.

@ Orion: I can share some advices and some tricks I have learnt, unfortunately (but also luckily) I have yet to understand how to play perfectly a character like this one.
I found myself very comfortable with the sorcerer spellsword's playstyle. Even if sorcerers are troubling to level at low levels, later on they blossom and become very strong.
Sorcerers can help you face unplanned circumstances, as you can cast almost each spell in every moment. Besides, in my opinion maximum flexibility means many tricks to learn ;)

I have enjoyed your druid DS playthrough, and I'm sure you'll find yourself comfortable with arcane casters!

Some little advices from my experience:
 - the shadow shield spell, especially when extended, can help you make room for amulets (+CON/+saves/+....) ;
 - WoG has some items that can help you cap charisma;
 - always have Bigby 6 spells at your disposal, they can help defeating wizards (I don't know how the fight would have been without a Bigby on Althea);
 - an interesting strategy for a battle with mages is to use a scroll of silence and sneak to a mage, and knock him/her down, he/she won't be able to do anything (of course, Althea has some scrolls to counterattack and it is immune to KDs so I don't advise doing this against her). Silent spell feat can help a lot, increasing flexibility and avoiding to be "disarmed" by another caster;
I have found in WoG offline module that in Rao's temple (or Heironeous one in Greyhawk, don't clearly remember) there are "Silence" spells scrolls that can used by paladins (strage, as this is not a Paladin spell);
 - darkness + ultravision combo is quite useful, however with some bosses in WoG (e.g. Althea/Vayne) it's like having a big flashing arrow into the top of your head, saying "target here, you ...".
 - craft wand feat can be quite useful during Tenser's, when you are not able to cast spells. Useful wands with this character can be made with spells as Haste/Improved invisibility/Identify/True strike/Invisibility/Darkness/Ultravision/Find traps/Keen edge/Elemental shield/Lesser spell breach/Wounding whispers/war cry.
 - Invisibility has often been, for me, an alternative to greater sanctuary when escaping from melee foes (I leave greater sanctuary for mages). As you cast stat buffs as empowered, you have room for 3-4 invisible uses;
 - my favourite strategy when facing threatening foes that don't melee (e.g. liches, demi-liches), is to have in my bag a 2-handed weapon (I love halberds) and cap STR + bless weapon + holy sword. My sorcerer/pally/CT has 30 STR, meaning 1d10+15+5 (greater magic weap) + 3d6 divine damage (this latter cannot be resisted).
 - You can sneak through traps and closed doors through your pixie (she has improved invisibility that make her avoid battles);
 - Be ready to change spells on quickslots if needed (even if it is a nuisance):when fighting wizards such as Althea, you will want to have time stop/mords/bigby/empowered an normal IGMS in the same row, preferrably into the middle of the bar so it is quicker to click on them;
 - Capping stat (INT/STR), even when playing a spellsword, can be quite useful as you can increase the number of spells at your disposal. In the above fight my charisma was 19; increasing it to 22-23 (for example, with a +4 ring in WoG) would have added 1 sixth spell, and to 28 a lv 9 lv spell, that is one more turn of time stop and IGMS to almost kill Althea safely.
This can help saves, if you want to build a Sor/Pal.
This is the main reason why I stubbornly want EMA in this build.

I take this exercise as a little brainstorming, so others who are much more keen with spellsword builds can correct/add if there is something wrong (so I can learn something new).

P.S.: one of my funniest moments with Althea was with my Sorc/Pal/CT, as she casted Bigby 9 and immobilized me, then (I don't know why) a Mords (maybe to dispel my buffs), that dispelled also Bigby's and allowed me to escape from her!
